alert.note: Alert for Chautauqua; Elk; Labette; Montgomery; Wilson (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 19 at 11:59PM CDT by NWS Wichita
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Elk, Wilson, southwestern Labette, Montgomery and eastern Chautauqua Counties through 1230 AM CDT... At 1159 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles south of Longton to Caney. Movement was northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Coffeyville, Independence, Neodesha, Fredonia, Cherryvale, Caney, Sedan, Dearing, Altoona, Longton, Elk City, Tyro, Peru, Liberty, Elk Falls, Havana, Bolton, Sycamore, Niotaze and Benedict. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 700 AM CDT for southeastern Kansas.
